availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Elijah Dudley Walker (Ohio County, Kentucky, attorney.)

body.p: Ohio County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Son of Richard Logan Walker and Mahala Walker. Married to Elvira English Walker in Hardin County on August 17, 1857. Father of Mahala Walker, Logan Walker, Lizzie Walker, and Lidah Walker. Attorney in Ohio County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Ohio County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Hartford, p. 785.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Hartford, p. 12.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Hartford, p. 500A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Hardin County Marriages, Film 000390788, p. 240.
Lineage Book of the Charter Members of the National Society of the Daughters of the American Revolution, eds. Mary S. Lockwood and Susan Riviere Hetzel (Washington, D. C.: National Society of the Daughters of the American Revolution, 1891-1939) vol. XXI: 1897, p. 119.
"Elijah Dudley Walker (1827-1898)," Find A Grave, Memorial 1258322476, accessed September 10, 2022.
